main event: Observation of an unidentified object in the sky over Newport, Rhode Island on April 5, 1956.
interesting points: The object appeared as a large grapefruit-shaped object, the size of a large grapefruit, at arm's length.
The object appeared in the north at an azimuth of approximately 350 degrees and climbed in a straight line up to an elevation of 350 degrees.
The object then started "whirling into the haze".
The object was observed through binoculars 6x30, with unlimited visibility and no surface wind at the time of the sighting.
The observation lasted for five minutes.
result: likely a letter-shaped balloon, possibly generated by weather balloons
